intro: Hieracium bryhnii, commonly known as the Bryhn's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. It has a low-growing habit with creeping stems and basal leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. The showy yellow flowers appear in late summer and are followed by small, dry fruits called achenes.
